snippet: Syrian fighters and activists who once gathered in southern Turkey to plan a revolution are now marooned, their hopes rapidly deflating.
abstract: Antakya Journal; Turkish city of Antakya, which is on border with Syria, experienced boom in early days of Syrian conflict when foreign fighters and activists used it as way station in their journey to join insurgents fighting government of Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; many of young men who joined insurgency have returned to Antakya, where they live a marooned existence, their hopes for future dashed with failure of revolution.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Syrian fighters and activists who once gathered in southern Turkey to plan a revolution are now marooned, their hopes rapidly deflating.

headline.main: Vanguard of Syria’s Uprising, Now on the Run From ISIS, Weighs a Bleak Future
headline.print_headline: Vanguard of Syrian Uprising, Now on the Run, Weighs a Bleak Future

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
